summary: This is an internal email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel forwarding a defense filing from Ghislaine Maxwell's attorney, Bobbi C. Sternheim, in the criminal case U.S. v. Maxwell. It shows routine case communication and coordination for a response.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney who filed the ECF document in the Maxwell case and sent the courtesy copy via email.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Copied on the original email from Bobbi Sternheim regarding the court filing.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Copied on the original email from Bobbi Sternheim regarding the court filing.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Listed in the email signature of Bobbi Sternheim's law office.

connections.description: Sternheim is filing legal documents on behalf of Maxwell in her criminal case.
Both are part of the defense legal team for Ghislaine Maxwell, as indicated by being copied together.
Both are associated with the Law Offices of Bobbi C. Sternheim.
Sternheim (defense) is corresponding with Everdell (prosecution) regarding a court filing.

events.title: Filing in U.S. v. Maxwell
events.description: Defense attorney Bobbi C. Sternheim files a document in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

locations: West 19th Street office (Law Offices of Bobbi C. Sternheim, New York, NY)
keyFacts: The email shows routine legal correspondence in the ongoing criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (S2 20 Cr. 330).
The defense filing was submitted electronically (ECF) on March 31, 2021, and a courtesy copy was emailed to the prosecution.
The prosecution team at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) is coordinating a response.
Bobbi C. Sternheim's law office was operating remotely due to the Covid-19 pandemic at the time.
